description:
Protomyces lactucae-debilis is a species of fungus that belongs to the genus Protomyces. It is a plant pathogen that infects the leaves and stems of the Lactuca debilis plant, also known as the weak lettuce.

This fungus is classified as an ascomycete, meaning it produces spore-bearing structures called asci during its life cycle. The mycelium of Protomyces lactucae-debilis grows within the host plant, and it can cause gall-like swellings or deformations on the affected tissues.

The infection by this fungus can lead to reduced growth and yield in the host plant, making it an important agricultural pest for lettuce growers. Understanding the biology and ecology of Protomyces lactucae-debilis is crucial for developing effective control measures and preventing crop losses.
